Development and implementation of theoretical models and an experimental setup to test various hypotheses about fundamental physical interactions using silicon Skipper CCD detectors, lasers and non-linear birefringent optical materials. My work was published in Physical Review Quantum, one of the leading journals in the field.
Member of the Quantum Standards Laboratory in the metrology department. Worked on several projects that involved hardware design, data production, and data analysis.

Designed, simulated, implemented and tested an innovative geometry for a high precision AC voltage divider for application in metrology. The prototype reached an accuracy of ~99.8% in a range from DC up to 10 kHz. The project was selected for participation at the CPEM 2018 conference, in Paris, which is the most important conference worldwide in the domain of electromagnetic measurements. I was awarded an Early Career Grant for this project.
